entry.title: Bitcoin Core 26.1 released
entry.summary:
The latest versions of Libre Relay have been released, offering significant updates and improvements for users. Version 26.1 is now accessible, providing a stable update with various enhancements to functionality. For those looking forward to more cutting-edge features, version 27.0rc1 has also been made available. This release candidate signifies a step towards the next stable version, incorporating more experimental changes that may benefit early adopters and developers looking to stay at the forefront of technology.
Both versions can be downloaded from their respective GitHub repositories. The stable version 26.1 can be found at [Libre Relay v26.1](https://github.com/petertodd/bitcoin/tree/libre-relay-v26.1), offering users a reliable update with fixes and improvements. Meanwhile, the release candidate for version 27.0, marked as 27.0rc1, is available at [Libre Relay v27.0rc1](https://github.com/petertodd/bitcoin/tree/libre-relay-v27.0rc1), presenting an opportunity for testing newer features before they become part of the next stable release. Further information and updates can be followed through Peter Todd's personal website at [Peter Todd's Official Website](https://petertodd.org).
For direct communication or inquiries regarding these releases, interested parties can reach out via email, utilizing the provided address, which suggests contacting 'peter' with the domain specified in the context, excluding the last character before the '@' symbol. This contact method ensures that feedback, questions, or contributions can be directed appropriately, facilitating engagement with the development process and allowing for direct interaction with one of the project's key contributors.
